wrath.client

Class Game.WindowManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.client.Game.WindowManager
  • Enclosing class:
    Game

    public class Game.WindowManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to manage anything to do with the Game Window.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void centerWindow()
      Centers the window in the middle of the designated primary monitor.
      void closeWindow()
      Destroys and deallocates all GLFW/window resources.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the window.
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the window.
      long getWindowID()
      Gets the GLFW Window ID.
      WindowState getWindowState()
      Gets the current state of the window as of WindowState.
      boolean isWindowOpen()
      Tells whether or not the window is open.
      void minimizeWindow()
      Force minimizes the window.
      void openWindow()
      Method to start the display.

      Takes a screen-shot and saves it to the file specified as a PNG.

      Takes a screen-shot and saves it to the file specified.

      Changes the size of the window.

    • Method Detail

      • centerWindow

        public void centerWindow()
        Centers the window in the middle of the designated primary monitor. Does not work in Fullscreen or Fulscreen_Windowed modes.

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow()
        Destroys and deallocates all GLFW/window resources.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the window.
        Returns:
        Returns the height (in pixels) of the window.

      • getWindowID

        public long getWindowID()
        Gets the GLFW Window ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the GLFW window ID.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the window.
        Returns:
        Returns the width (in pixels) of the window.

      • getWindowState

        public WindowState getWindowState()
        Gets the current state of the window as of WindowState.
        Returns:
        Returns the current state of the window.

      • isWindowOpen

        public boolean isWindowOpen()
        Tells whether or not the window is open.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the window is open, otherwise false.

      • minimizeWindow

        public void minimizeWindow()
        Force minimizes the window.

      • openWindow

        public void openWindow()
        Method to start the display. Made independent from start() so window options can be adjusted without restarting game.

      • screenShot

        public void screenShot(java.lang.String saveToName)
        Takes a screen-shot and saves it to the file specified as a PNG.
        Parameters:
        saveToName - The name of the file to save the screen-shot to (excluding file extension).

      • screenShot

        public void screenShot(java.lang.String saveToName,
                       ImageFormat format)
        Takes a screen-shot and saves it to the file specified.
        Parameters:
        saveToName - The name of the file to save the screen-shot to (excluding file extension).
        format - The format to save the image as.

      • setResolution

        public void setResolution(int width,
                          int height)
        Changes the size of the window.
        Parameters:
        width - New width of the window, measured in pixels.
        height - New height of the window, measures in pixels.

      • setWindowState

        public void setWindowState(WindowState state)
        Changes the state of the window. This method will require the window to restart, and this will be done via closeWindow() and openWindow().
        Parameters:
        state - The state to set the window to.
